engine

Class Engine

  • java.lang.Object
    • engine.Engine

  • public class Engine
extends java.lang.Object

    A class to initialise a 2D grid-world River Crossing Dilemma environment and the agent population(s) that inhabit it.

    An RCD instance is made of grass cells, with a column of Water objects in the centre, which creates an impassable river. Each agent in the environment is allocated two Resources to collect in order to achieve its goal (one on either side of the river). A bridge can be built by placing Stones into the river. The number of Stones needed to create a bridge successfully is equal to the depth of the river.

    Currently the agents evolve with a Steady State Genetic Algorithm in order to learn how to achieve their goals. A goal-rational agent can be created, or one that uses both goal-rational and traditional action, or goal-rational and random action. Agents can not yet employ more than two types of social action.

    Visualisations of the state of the environment and the decision-making processes of the agents can be turned on with the TURN_ON_VISUALS field, and a graph of the performance with the TURN_ON_GRAPH field.

    Version:
    v1.2
    Author:
    Chloe M. Barnes

    • Constructor Detail

      • Engine

        public Engine(int numAgentPopulations,
              boolean fromRandom,
              double goalRationality,
              int gens,
              int iters,
              ActionType at,
              int[] seeds)
        Creates a new Engine that will generate a River Crossing Dilemma instance and run the evolutionary process for the specified number of generations, and repeat for a specified number of iterations. An environment can be created with 1:* agents in it, either from a random seed or a specified seed, that will evolve in order to achieve their goals. The agent(s) in the environment use either goal-rational action or a specified social action type as well as goal-rationality.
        Parameters:
        numAgentPopulations - The number of Agent populations to exist in the environment (usually 1 or 2).
        fromRandom - true if the agent(s) should be initialised with random weights, false if seeds are specified.
        seeds - An array of seeds that the agents should be initialised from - if the first element contains a non-zero integer element. If the first element is 0, agents will be randomly initialised. A mixture of non-zero and zero elements can be specified; elements that equal 0 will randomly initialise an agent, whereas non-zero ones will be initialised with the element as the seed (as long as the first element is non-zero).
        goalRationality - The percentage of Agent actions that will be goal-rational (1.0 for fully goal-rational). If < 1, there will be a percentage chance for actions to be of the specified ActionType.
        gens - The number of generations that the Agent(s) will evolve for.
        iters - The number of iterations that the evolutionary process will be run for, default is 1 (> 1 is useful for graphing average performance across a number of iterations of evolution).
        at - The action type that the Agent(s) will employ, default ActionType.GOAL_RATIONAL. If not GOAL_RATIONAL, then there will be a percentage chance (specified with the goalRationality param) for the specified action type to occur, with goal-rational action occuring the remainder of the time.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Parameters:
        args - The program requires the following arguments:
        1. int numAgentPopulations - the number of agents present in an environment (i.e. 1 for alone, 2 for together).
        2. boolean fromRandom - true if the agent(s) should be randomly initialised, false if the agent(s) should be initialised from the given seeds.
        3. double goalRationality - percentage of actions that are goal-rational (i.e. 1.0 for fully goal-rational).
        4. int generations - the number of generations the agent(s) should evolve for.
        5. int iterations - the number of times the evolutionary process will be repeated. Usually set as 1; only used when visuals are turned on to see averages graphed in live-time over a number of iterations.
        6. ActionType type - the type of action the agent(s) express: GOAL-RATIONAL, TRADITIONAL (and GR), RANDOM (and GR).
        7. int[] seeds - the remaining arguments are parsed as seeds. If the first element of the array is 0 then the agent(s) will be randomly initialised, regardless of whether the array contains other non-zero elements. If the first element of the array is non-zero (negative values valid), then the agent will be initialised with that seed; subsequent agents will be initialised with a seed if the array element is non-zero, or randomly initialised if 0.

      • evolve

        protected void evolve(boolean randomise,
                      int[] seeds)
               throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException

        Evolves agents with a Steady State Genetic Algorithm in order for them to learn how to achieve their goals in the environment. Progress of the evolutionary process is output to files, using the seed of the first agent in the environment as the directory name.

        Agents can be initialised with random weights, from a mixture of specified seeds and random seeds, or the evolution can continue from a previous state of the population(s) without re-initialisation of the weights (when evolving agents alone, and then evolving them together for example).

        Parameters:
        randomise - true if the agents should be initialised from random weights, false if they should be initialised from specified weights, or if the evolution should carry on from a previous state of the agent population(s), in which case no new initialisation takes place.
        seeds - The seeds in which the agent population(s) are to be initialised from. If the first element is 0, and randomise is false, the evolution will carry on from a previous state of the agent population(s). If randomise is true, the seeds array is ignored and the agent population(s) is randomly initialised. If the first element is non-zero, the element is used as a seed to initialise the agent populations; any subsequent elements that are 0 will mean that the population with that index is randomly initialised. If both
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException

      • getStandardDeviationFitness

        protected double getStandardDeviationFitness(int popNum,
                                             double avg)
        Calculates and returns the standard deviation of fitness across a specified agent population.
        Parameters:

        avg - The average fitness of the specified population.
        Returns:
        The calculated standard deviation of the specified population, given the average.

      • newSeed

        protected void newSeed()
        Generates a new random seed, and sets the seed of the random variables.

      • loop

        protected void loop(Agent[] a,
                    boolean showViews)
        Sets up an environment instance with the specified agent(s), which have a maximum number of time-steps to achieve their goals. The run will stop when all agents in the environment have achieved their goals, or if the maximum number of time-steps has been reached. Note: this currently only works with one or two agents.
        Parameters:
        a - An array of agents to be placed into the environment instance. This is not a whole population of agents, just those individuals who will compete in this run. The index of the element in the array correlates to the population number of the agents container.
        showViews - true if the visualisations of the environment and the activity landscape (decision-making processes of the agent(s)) should be displayed, false otherwise.

      • update

        protected void update(boolean showViews)
        Updates the model of the environment for one time-step, as well as any views that visualise the model. The run will stop if all agents in the environment are no longer alive.
        Parameters:
        showViews - true if the visualisations of the environment and the activity landscape (decision-making processes of the agent(s)) should be displayed, false otherwise.

      • fitnessArrayToString

        protected java.lang.String fitnessArrayToString(int popNum)
        Generates a comma-separated String of all of the fitness in a specified population.
        Parameters:
        popNum - The index of the population to generate a fitness String for.
        Returns:
        A comma-separated String of all of the fitnesses in a specified population.

      • printFilePrefix

        protected java.lang.String printFilePrefix()
        Generates a String containing the data for the run, including the seed, iteration and time. Used as a file header.
        Returns:
        A String containing data for the run.

      • printFileSuffix

        protected java.lang.String printFileSuffix()
        Generates a String containing the data for the run, including time taken and iteration. Used as a file footer.
        Returns:
        A String containing data for the run.

      • writeToFile

        protected void writeToFile(java.lang.String filename,
                           java.lang.String content)
        Writes the given content to a given filename.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file to write to.
        content - The content to write to the specified file.

      • setupFilenames

        protected void setupFilenames()
        Sets up the String representation of the CSV filenames that are used to contain the output data for the runs. Filenames begin with the directoryName specified, which is usually the first seed that is used in the run.
